casebody.data:
ALABAMA GREAT SOUTHERN RAILROAD COMPANY, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. ALLIED CHEMICAL CORPORATION, Armco Steel Corporation, and General American Transportation Corporation, Defendants-Appellants. No. 73-3057. United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. March 6, 1975. Sherwood W. Wise, Thomas G. Lilly, Jackson, Miss., for Allied Chemical. Junior O’Mara, Jackson, Miss., for General Am. Transportation. W. F. Goodman, Jr., Jackson, Miss., for Armco Steel. Lewis T. Booker, Robert F. Brooks, Richmond, Va., Tally D. Riddell, Quit-man, Miss., Charles A. Horsky, Washington, D. C., for plaintiff-appellee.

Before BROWN, Chief Judge, and GEWIN, BELL, THORNBERRY, COLEMAN, GOLDBERG, AINSWORTH, GODBOLD, DYER, SIMPSON, MORGAN, RONEY and GEE *, Circuit Judges.

Judges WISDOM and CLARK took no part in the hearing of this case en banc.

 PER CURIAM:

The panel opinion in this case is reported, 501 F.2d 94 (1974). Thereafter, rehearing en banc was granted.

Upon supplemental briefs and oral argument we adopt the panel opinion and decision as our own.

Accordingly, the judgment of the district court stands reversed on direct appeal and affirmed on cross appeal.
